Its data is not written to persistent storage."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5487(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5489(primary) msgid "non-persistent volume"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5495(para) msgid "Alternative term for an ephemeral volume."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5500(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5510(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5523(primary) msgid "nova"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5503(para) msgid "OpenStack project that provides compute services."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5508(glossterm) msgid "Nova API"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5516(para) msgid "Alternative term for the Compute API."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5521(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5525(secondary) msgid "nova-network"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5529(para) msgid "A Compute component that manages IP address allocation, firewalls, and other network-related tasks. This is the legacy networking option and an alternative to Networking."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5539(title) msgid "O"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5542(glossterm) msgid "object"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5550(para) msgid "A BLOB of data held by Object Storage; can be in any format."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5556(glossterm) msgid "object auditor"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5560(secondary) msgid "object auditors"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5564(para) msgid "Opens all objects for an object server and verifies the MD5 hash, size, and metadata for each object."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5570(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5574(secondary) msgid "object expiration"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5578(para) msgid "A configurable option within Object Storage to automatically delete objects after a specified amount of time has passed or a certain date is reached."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5585(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5589(secondary) msgid "object hash"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5593(para) msgid "Uniquely ID for an Object Storage object."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5598(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5602(secondary) msgid "object path hash"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5606(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine the location of an object in the ring. Maps objects to partitions."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5612(glossterm) msgid "object replicator"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5616(secondary) msgid "object replicators"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5620(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that copies an object to remote partitions for fault tolerance."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5626(glossterm) msgid "object server"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5630(secondary) msgid "object servers"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5634(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that is responsible for managing objects."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5640(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5657(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5670(primary) msgid "Object Storage"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5643(para) msgid "The OpenStack core project that provides eventually consistent and redundant storage and retrieval of fixed digital content. The project name of OpenStack Object Storage is swift."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5650(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5654(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5659(secondary) msgid "Object Storage API"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5652(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7708(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7731(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7745(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7769(primary) msgid "swift"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5663(para) msgid "API used to access OpenStack Object Storage."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5668(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5672(secondary) msgid "Object Storage Device (OSD)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5676(para) msgid "The Ceph storage daemon."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5681(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5685(secondary) msgid "object versioning"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5689(para) msgid "Allows a user to set a flag on an Object Storage container so that all objects within the container are versioned."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5695(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5697(primary) msgid "Oldie"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5701(para) msgid "Term for an Object Storage process that runs for a long time. Can indicate a hung process."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5707(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5710(primary) msgid "Open Cloud Computing Interface (OCCI)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5714(para) msgid "A standardized interface for managing compute, data, and network resources, currently unsupported in OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5720(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5722(primary) msgid "Open Virtualization Format (OVF)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5726(para) msgid "Standard for packaging VM images. Supported in OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5731(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5733(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5751(primary) msgid "Open vSwitch"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5737(para) msgid "Open vSwitch is a production quality, multilayer virtual switch licensed under the open source Apache 2.0 license. It is designed to enable massive network automation through programmatic extension, while still supporting standard management interfaces and protocols (for example NetFlow, sFlow, SPAN, RSPAN, CLI, LACP, 802.1ag)."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5749(glossterm) msgid "Open vSwitch neutron plug-in"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5757(para) msgid "Provides support for Open vSwitch in Networking."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5762(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5764(primary) msgid "OpenLDAP"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5768(para) msgid "An open source LDAP server. Supported by both Compute and Identity Service."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5774(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5776(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5794(primary) msgid "OpenStack"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5782(para) msgid "OpenStack is a cloud operating system that controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their users to provision resources through a web interface. OpenStack is an open source project licensed under the Apache License 2.0."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5792(glossterm) msgid "OpenStack code name"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5795(secondary) msgid "code name"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5799(para) msgid "Each OpenStack release has a code name. Code names ascend in alphabetical order: Austin, Bexar, Cactus, Diablo, Essex, Folsom, Grizzly, Havana, Icehouse, Juno, and Kilo. Code names are cities or counties near where the corresponding OpenStack design summit took place. An exception, called the Waldon exception, is granted to elements of the state flag that sound especially cool. Code names are chosen by popular vote."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5813(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5815(primary) msgid "openSUSE"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5824(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5826(primary) msgid "operator"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5830(para) msgid "The person responsible for planning and maintaining an OpenStack installation."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5836(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5838(primary) msgid "Orchestration"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5842(para) msgid "An integrated project that orchestrates multiple cloud applications for OpenStack. The project name of Orchestration is heat."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5849(glossterm) msgid "orphan"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5851(primary) msgid "orphans"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5855(para) msgid "In the context of Object Storage, this is a process that is not terminated after an upgrade, restart, or reload of the service."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5864(title) msgid "P"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5867(glossterm) msgid "parent cell"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5871(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5874(primary) msgid "parent cells"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5878(para) msgid "If a requested resource, such as CPU time, disk storage, or memory, is not available in the parent cell, the request is forwarded to associated child cells."msgid "partition"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5887(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5902(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5916(primary) msgid "partitions"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5893(para) msgid "A unit of storage within Object Storage used to store objects. It exists on top of devices and is replicated for fault tolerance."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5900(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5904(secondary) msgid "partition index"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5908(para) msgid "Contains the locations of all Object Storage partitions within the ring."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5914(glossterm) msgid "partition shift value"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5918(secondary) msgid "partition index value"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5922(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine which partition data should reside on."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5928(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5930(primary) msgid "pause"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5934(para) msgid "A VM state where no changes occur (no changes in memory, network communications stop, etc); the VM is frozen but not shut down."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5940(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5942(primary) msgid "PCI passthrough"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5946(para) msgid "Gives guest VMs exclusive access to a PCI device. Currently supported in OpenStack Havana and later releases."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5952(glossterm) msgid "persistent message"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5956(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5959(primary) msgid "persistent messages"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5963(para) msgid "A message that is stored both in memory and on disk. The message is not lost after a failure or restart."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5969(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5971(primary) msgid "persistent volume"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5975(para) msgid "Changes to these types of disk volumes are saved."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5980(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5982(primary) msgid "personality file"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5986(para) msgid "A file used to customize a Compute instance. It can be used to inject SSH keys or a specific network configuration."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5992(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5994(primary) msgid "Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5998(para) msgid "Provides to the consumer the ability to deploy applications through a programming language or tools supported by the cloud platform provider. An example of Platform-as-a-Service is an Eclipse/Java programming platform provided with no downloads required."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6007(glossterm) msgid "plug-in"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6009(primary) msgid "plug-ins, definition of"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6013(para) msgid "Software component providing the actual implementation for Networking APIs, or for Compute APIs, depending on the context."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6019(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6021(primary) msgid "policy service"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6025(para) msgid "Component of Identity Service that provides a rule-management interface and a rule-based authorization engine."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6031(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6033(primary) msgid "pool"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6037(para) msgid "A logical set of devices, such as web servers, that you group together to receive and process traffic. The load balancing function chooses which member of the pool handles the new requests or connections received on the VIP address. Each VIP has one pool."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6046(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6048(primary) msgid "pool member"msgid "An application that runs on the back-end server in a load-balancing system."msgid "port"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6060(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6074(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:8305(primary) msgid "ports"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6066(para) msgid "A virtual network port within Networking; With a soft reboot, the operating system is signaled to restart, which enables a graceful shutdown of all processes. A hard reboot is the equivalent of power cycling the server. The virtualization platform should ensure that the reboot action has completed successfully, even in cases in which the underlying domain/VM is paused or halted/stopped."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6574(glossterm) msgid "rebuild"msgid "rebuilding"msgid "Removes all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image. Examples include mail exchange (MX) records, which specify the mail server for a particular domain; and name server (NS) records, which specify the authoritative name servers for a domain."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6616(glossterm) msgid "record ID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6620(secondary) msgid "record IDs"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6624(para) msgid "A number within a database that is incremented each time a change is made. msgid "request ID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6775(primary) msgid "request IDs"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6779(para) msgid "Unique ID assigned to each request sent to Compute."#: Public IP addresses can be shared across multiple servers for use in various high-availability scenarios. When an IP address is shared to another server, the cloud network restrictions are modified to enable each server to listen to and respond on that IP address. You can optionally specify that the target server network configuration be modified. Shared IP addresses can be used with many standard heartbeat facilities, such as keepalive, that monitor for failure and manage IP failover."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7319(glossterm) msgid "shared IP group"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7321(primary) msgid "shared IP groups"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7325(para) msgid "A collection of servers that can share IPs with other members of the group. Any server in a group can share one or more public IPs with any other server in the group. With the exception of the first server in a shared IP group, servers must be launched into shared IP groups. A server may be a member of only one shared IP group."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7334(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7336(primary) msgid "shared storage"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7340(para) msgid "Block storage that is simultaneously accessible by multiple clients, for example, NFS."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7346(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7348(primary) msgid "Sheepdog"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7352(para) msgid "Distributed block storage system for QEMU, supported by OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7358(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7361(primary) msgid "Simple Cloud Identity Management (SCIM)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7365(para) msgid "Specification for managing identity in the cloud, currently unsupported by OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7371(glossterm) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7374(primary) msgid "Single-root I/O Virtualization (SR-IOV)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7378(para) msgid "A specification that, when implemented by a physical PCIe device, enables it to appear as multiple separate PCIe devices. Buttons to start, stop, and suspend VMs are in one class. Buttons to associate and disassociate floating IP addresses are in another class, and so on." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1023(primary) msgid "bytes, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1022(glossterm) msgid "byte" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1027(para) msgid "Set of bits that make up a single character; there are usually 8 bits to a byte." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1036(title) msgid "C" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1040(primary) msgid "CA (Certificate/Certification Authority)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1039(glossterm) msgid "CA" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1044(para) msgid "Certificate Authority or Certification Authority. In cryptography, an entity that issues digital certificates. The digital certificate certifies the ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate. This enables others (relying parties) to rely upon signatures or assertions made by the private key that corresponds to the certified public key. In this model of trust relationships, a CA is a trusted third party for both the subject (owner) of the certificate and the party relying upon the certificate. CAs are characteristic of many public key infrastructure (PKI) schemes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1059(primary) msgid "cache pruners" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1058(glossterm) msgid "cache pruner" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1063(para) msgid "A program that keeps the Image Service VM image cache at or below its configured maximum size." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1070(primary) msgid "Cactus" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1069(glossterm) msgid "Cactus" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1074(para) msgid "An OpenStack grouped release of projects that came out in the spring of 2011. It included Compute (nova), Object Storage (swift), and the Image Service (glance)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1077(para) msgid "Cactus is a city in Texas, US and is the code name for the third release of OpenStack. When OpenStack releases went from three to six months long, the code name of the release changed to match a geography nearest the previous summit." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1085(glossterm) msgid "CADF" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1087(para) msgid "Cloud Auditing Data Federation (CADF) is a specification for audit event data. CADF is supported by OpenStack Identity." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1097(primary) msgid "CALL" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1096(glossterm) msgid "CALL" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1101(para) msgid "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. Can apply to the specific services within a cell or a whole cell." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1122(primary) msgid "capacity cache"msgid "capacity cache"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1126(para) msgid "A Compute back-end database table that contains the current workload, amount of free RAM, and number of VMs running on each host. Used to determine on which VM a host starts."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1134(primary) msgid "capacity updater"msgid "capacity updater"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1138(para) msgid "A notification driver that monitors VM instances and updates the capacity cache as needed."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1145(primary) msgid "CAST (RPC primitive)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1144(glossterm) msgid "CAST"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1149(para) msgid "One of the RPC primitives used by the OpenStack message queue software. ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1802(para) msgid "An official OpenStack project. Currently consists of Compute (nova), Object Storage (swift), Image Service (glance), Identity (keystone), Dashboard (horizon), Networking (neutron), and Block Storage (cinder). The Telemetry module (ceilometer) and Orchestration module (heat) are integrated projects as of the Havana release. In the Icehouse release, the Database module (trove) gains integrated project status." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1814(primary) msgid "cost" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1813(glossterm) msgid "cost" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1818(para) msgid "Under the Compute distributed scheduler, this is calculated by looking at the capabilities of each host relative to the flavor of the VM instance being requested." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1826(primary) msgid "credentials" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1825(glossterm) msgid "credentials" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1830(para) msgid "Data that is only known to or accessible by a user and used to verify that the user is who he says he is. Credentials are presented to the server during authentication. Examples include a password, secret key, digital certificate, and fingerprint." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1839(primary) msgid "Crowbar" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1838(glossterm) msgid "Crowbar" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1843(para) msgid "An open source community project by Dell that aims to provide all necessary services to quickly deploy clouds." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1850(primary) msgid "current workload" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1849(glossterm) msgid "current workload" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1854(para) msgid "An element of the Compute capacity cache that is calculated based on the number of build, snapshot, migrate, and resize operations currently in progress on a given host." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1862(primary) msgid "customers" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1864(see) msgid "tenants" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1861(glossterm) msgid "customer" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1868(para) msgid "Alternative term for tenant." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1874(primary) msgid "customization module" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1873(glossterm) msgid "customization module" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1878(para) msgid "A user-created Python module that is loaded by horizon to change the look and feel of the dashboard." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1887(title) msgid "D" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1891(primary) msgid "daemons" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1890(glossterm) msgid "daemon" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1897(para) msgid "A process that runs in the background and waits for requests. May or may not listen on a TCP or UDP port. Do not confuse with a worker." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1905(primary) msgid "DAC (discretionary access control)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1904(glossterm) msgid "DAC" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1909(para) msgid "Discretionary access control. Governs the ability of subjects to access objects, while enabling users to make policy decisions and assign security attributes. The traditional UNIX system of users, groups, and read-write-execute permissions is an example of DAC." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1919(primary) msgid "dashboard" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1918(glossterm) msgid "dashboard" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1923(para) msgid "The web-based management interface for OpenStack. An alternative name for horizon." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1930(primary) msgid "data" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1932(secondary) msgid "data encryption" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1929(glossterm) msgid "data encryption" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1936(para) msgid "Both Image Service and Compute support encrypted virtual machine (VM) images (but not instances). In-transit data encryption is supported in OpenStack using technologies such as HTTPS, SSL, TLS, and SSH. Object Storage does not support object encryption at the application level but may support storage that uses disk encryption." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1947(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1960(primary) msgid "databases" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1949(secondary) msgid "database ID" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1946(glossterm) msgid "database ID" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1953(para) msgid "A unique ID given to each replica of an Object Storage database." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1962(secondary) msgid "database replicators" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1959(glossterm) msgid "database replicator" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1966(para) msgid "An Object Storage component that copies changes in the account, container, and object databases to other nodes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1973(primary) msgid "Database Service" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1972(glossterm) msgid "Database Service" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1977(para) msgid "An integrated project that provide scalable and reliable Cloud Database-as-a-Service functionality for both relational and non-relational database engines. The project name of Database Service is trove." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1988(primary) msgid "deallocate, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:1987(glossterm) msgid "deallocate"msgid "The process of removing the association between a floating IP address and a fixed IP address. ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:2141(para) msgid "Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. A network protocol that configures devices that are connected to a network so that they can communicate on that network by using the Internet Protocol (IP). The design summit took place in Portland, Oregon, US and Havana is an unincorporated community in Oregon."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3274(primary) msgid "heat"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3273(glossterm) msgid "heat"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3278(para) msgid "An integrated project that aims to orchestrate multiple cloud applications for OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3285(primary) msgid "Heat Orchestration Template (HOT)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3284(glossterm) msgid "Heat Orchestration Template (HOT)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3289(para) msgid "Heat input in the format native to OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3295(primary) msgid "health monitor"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3294(glossterm) msgid "health monitor"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3299(para) msgid "Determines whether back-end members of a VIP pool can process a request. A pool can have several health monitors associated with it. When a pool has several monitors associated with it, all monitors check each member of the pool. All monitors must declare a member to be healthy for it to stay active."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3309(glossterm) msgid "horizon"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3312(para) msgid "OpenStack project that provides a dashboard, which is a web interface."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3319(primary) msgid "horizon plug-ins"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3318(glossterm) msgid "horizon plug-in"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3323(para) msgid "A plug-in for the OpenStack dashboard (horizon)."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3329(primary) msgid "hosts, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3328(glossterm) msgid "host" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3333(para) msgid "A physical computer, not a VM instance (node)." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3339(primary) msgid "host aggregate" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3338(glossterm) msgid "host aggregate" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3343(para) msgid "A method to further subdivide availability zones into hypervisor pools, a collection of common hosts." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3350(primary) msgid "Host Bus Adapter (HBA)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3349(glossterm) msgid "Host Bus Adapter (HBA)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3354(para) msgid "Device plugged into a PCI slot, such as a fibre channel or network card." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3361(primary) msgid "HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3360(glossterm) msgid "HTTP" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3367(para) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol. HTTP is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. It is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web. Hypertext is structured text that uses logical links (hyperlinks) between nodes containing text. HTTP is the protocol to exchange or transfer hypertext." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3378(primary) msgid "HTTPS (Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3377(glossterm) msgid "HTTPS" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3382(para) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is a communications protocol for secure communication over a computer network, with especially wide deployment on the Internet. Technically, it is not a protocol in and of itself; rather, it is the result of simply layering the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) on top of the SSL/TLS protocol, thus adding the security capabilities of SSL/TLS to standard HTTP communications." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3394(primary) msgid "Hyper-V" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3393(glossterm) msgid "Hyper-V" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3398(para) msgid "One of the hypervisors supported by OpenStack."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3404(primary) msgid "hyperlink"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3403(glossterm) msgid "hyperlink"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3408(para) msgid "Any kind of text that contains a link to some other site, commonly found in documents where clicking on a word or words opens up a different website."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3415(glossterm) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3418(para) msgid "The protocol that tells browsers where to go to find information."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3424(glossterm) msgid "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3427(para) msgid "Encrypted HTTP communications using SSL or TLS; most OpenStack API endpoints and many inter-component communications support HTTPS communication."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3435(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3448(primary) msgid "hypervisors"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3434(glossterm) msgid "hypervisor"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3441(para) msgid "Software that arbitrates and controls VM access to the actual underlying hardware."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3450(secondary) msgid "hypervisor pools"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3447(glossterm) msgid "hypervisor pool"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3454(para) msgid "A collection of hypervisors grouped together through host aggregates."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3463(title) msgid "I"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3467(primary) msgid "IaaS (Infrastructure-as-a-Service)"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3466(glossterm) msgid "IaaS"msgid "Infrastructure-as-a-Service. IaaS is a provisioning model in which an organization outsources physical components of a data center, such as storage, hardware, servers, and networking components. A service provider owns the equipment and is responsible for housing, operating and maintaining it. The client typically pays on a per-use basis. IaaS is a model for providing cloud services."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3484(primary) msgid "Icehouse"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3483(glossterm) msgid "Icehouse"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3490(para) msgid "The code name for the ninth release of OpenStack. It consists of sections and key value pairs."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3773(primary) msgid "injection"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3772(glossterm) msgid "injection"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3777(para) msgid "The process of putting a file into a virtual machine image before the instance is started."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3784(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3797(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3809(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3832(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3846(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3858(primary) msgid "instances" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3783(glossterm) msgid "instance" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3790(para) msgid "A running VM, or a VM in a known state such as suspended, that can be used like a hardware server." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3799(secondary) msgid "instance ID"msgid "instance ID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3803(para) msgid "Alternative term for instance UUID."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3811(secondary) msgid "instance state"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3808(glossterm) msgid "instance state"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3815(para) msgid "The current state of a guest VM image."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3821(primary) msgid "instance tunnels network"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3820(glossterm) msgid "instance tunnels network"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3825(para) msgid "A network segment used for instance traffic tunnels between compute nodes and the network node."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3834(secondary) msgid "instance type"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3831(glossterm) msgid "instance type"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3838(para) msgid "Describes the parameters of the various virtual machine images that are available to users; includes parameters such as CPU, storage, and memory. IPMI is a standardized computer system interface used by system administrators for out-of-band management of computer systems and monitoring of their operation. In layman's terms, it is a way to manage a computer using a direct network connection, whether it is turned on or not; connecting to the hardware rather than an operating system or login shell."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3967(primary) msgid "ip6tables"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3966(glossterm) msgid "ip6tables"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3971(para) msgid "Tool used to set up, maintain, and inspect the tables of IPv6 packet filter rules in the Linux kernel. In OpenStack Compute, ip6tables is used along with arptables, ebtables, and iptables to create firewalls for both nodes and VMs." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3980(primary) msgid "iptables" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3979(glossterm) msgid "iptables" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3984(para) msgid "Used along with arptables and ebtables, iptables create firewalls in Compute. iptables are the tables provided by the Linux kernel firewall (implemented as different Netfilter modules) and the chains and rules it stores. Different kernel modules and programs are currently used for different protocols: iptables applies to IPv4, ip6tables to IPv6, arptables to ARP, and ebtables to Ethernet frames. Requires root privilege to manipulate." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3996(primary) msgid "iSCSI protocol" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:3995(glossterm) msgid "iSCSI" This is the legacy networking option and an alternative to Networking."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4939(title) msgid "O"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4942(glossterm) msgid "object"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4949(para) msgid "A BLOB of data held by Object Storage; can be in any format."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4958(secondary) msgid "object auditors" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4955(glossterm) msgid "object auditor" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4962(para) msgid "Opens all objects for an object server and verifies the MD5 hash, size, and metadata for each object." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4971(secondary) msgid "object expiration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4968(glossterm) msgid "object expiration" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4975(para) msgid "A configurable option within Object Storage to automatically delete objects after a specified amount of time has passed or a certain date is reached." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4985(secondary) msgid "object hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4982(glossterm) msgid "object hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4989(para) msgid "Uniquely ID for an Object Storage object." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4997(secondary) msgid "object path hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:4994(glossterm) msgid "object path hash" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5001(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine the location of an object in the ring. Supported by both Compute and Identity Service."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5141(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5158(primary) msgid "OpenStack"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5140(glossterm) msgid "OpenStack"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5147(para) msgid "OpenStack is a cloud operating system that controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their users to provision resources through a web interface. OpenStack is an open source project licensed under the Apache License 2.0."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5159(secondary) msgid "code name"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5157(glossterm) msgid "OpenStack code name"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5163(para) msgid "Each OpenStack release has a code name. Code names ascend in alphabetical order: Austin, Bexar, Cactus, Diablo, Essex, Folsom, Grizzly, Havana, Icehouse, Juno, and Kilo. Code names are cities or counties near where the corresponding OpenStack design summit took place. An exception, called the Waldon exception, is granted to elements of the state flag that sound especially cool. Code names are chosen by popular vote." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5178(primary) msgid "openSUSE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5177(glossterm) msgid "openSUSE" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5188(primary) msgid "operator"msgid "operator"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5192(para) msgid "The person responsible for planning and maintaining an OpenStack installation."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5199(primary) msgid "Orchestration"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5198(glossterm) msgid "Orchestration"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5203(para) msgid "An integrated project that orchestrates multiple cloud applications for OpenStack. The project name of Orchestration is heat."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5211(primary) msgid "orphans"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5210(glossterm) msgid "orphan"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5215(para) msgid "In the context of Object Storage, this is a process that is not terminated after an upgrade, restart, or reload of the service."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5224(title) msgid "P"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5230(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5232(primary) msgid "parent cells"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5227(glossterm) msgid "parent cell"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5236(para) msgid "If a requested resource, such as CPU time, disk storage, or memory, is not available in the parent cell, the request is forwarded to associated child cells."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5244(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5258(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5271(primary) msgid "partitions"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5243(glossterm) msgid "partition"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5250(para) msgid "A unit of storage within Object Storage used to store objects. It exists on top of devices and is replicated for fault tolerance."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5260(secondary) msgid "partition index"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5257(glossterm) msgid "partition index"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5264(para) msgid "Contains the locations of all Object Storage partitions within the ring."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5273(secondary) msgid "partition index value"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5270(glossterm) msgid "partition shift value"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5277(para) msgid "Used by Object Storage to determine which partition data should reside on."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5284(primary) msgid "pause"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5283(glossterm) msgid "pause"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5288(para) msgid "A VM state where no changes occur (no changes in memory, network communications stop, etc); the VM is frozen but not shut down."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5295(primary) msgid "PCI passthrough"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5294(glossterm) msgid "PCI passthrough"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5299(para) msgid "Gives guest VMs exclusive access to a PCI device. Currently supported in OpenStack Havana and later releases."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5308(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5310(primary) msgid "persistent messages"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5305(glossterm) msgid "persistent message"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5314(para) msgid "A message that is stored both in memory and on disk. The message is not lost after a failure or restart."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5321(primary) msgid "persistent volume"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5320(glossterm) msgid "persistent volume" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5325(para) msgid "Changes to these types of disk volumes are saved." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5331(primary) msgid "personality file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5330(glossterm) msgid "personality file" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5335(para) msgid "A file used to customize a Compute instance. It can be used to inject SSH keys or a specific network configuration." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5342(primary) msgid "Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5341(glossterm) msgid "Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5346(para) msgid "Provides to the consumer the ability to deploy applications through a programming language or tools supported by the cloud platform provider. An example of Platform-as-a-Service is an Eclipse/Java programming platform provided with no downloads required." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5356(primary) msgid "plug-ins, definition of" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5355(glossterm) msgid "plug-in"msgid "Software component providing the actual implementation for Networking APIs, or for Compute APIs, depending on the context."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5367(primary) msgid "policy service"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5366(glossterm) msgid "policy service"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5371(para) msgid "Component of Identity Service that provides a rule-management interface and a rule-based authorization engine."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5378(primary) msgid "pool"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5377(glossterm) msgid "pool" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5382(para) msgid "A logical set of devices, such as web servers, that you group together to receive and process traffic. The load balancing function chooses which member of the pool handles the new requests or connections received on the VIP address. Each VIP has one pool." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5392(primary) msgid "pool member" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5391(glossterm) msgid "pool member"msgid "An application that runs on the back-end server in a load-balancing system."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5403(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5416(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:7465(primary) msgid "ports"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5402(glossterm) msgid "port"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5409(para) msgid "A virtual network port within Networking; VIFs / vNICs are connected to a port."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5418(secondary) msgid "port UUID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5415(glossterm) msgid "port UUID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5422(para) msgid "Unique ID for a Networking port."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5428(primary) msgid "preseed, definition of"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5427(glossterm) msgid "preseed"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5432(para) msgid "A tool to automate system configuration and installation on Debian-based Linux distributions."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5439(primary) msgid "private image"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5438(glossterm) msgid "private image"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5443(para) msgid "An Image Service VM image that is only available to specified tenants."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5452(secondary) msgid "private"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5454(primary) msgid "private IP address"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5449(glossterm) msgid "private IP address"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5458(para) msgid "An IP address used for management and administration, not available to the public Internet."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5467(secondary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5469(primary) msgid "private networks"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5464(glossterm) msgid "private network"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5473(para) msgid "The Network Controller provides virtual networks to enable compute servers to interact with each other and with the public network. All machines must have a public and private network interface. A private network interface can be a flat or VLAN network interface. A flat network interface is controlled by the flat_interface with flat managers. A VLAN network interface is controlled by the vlan_interface option with VLAN managers."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5486(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5499(primary) ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5512(primary) msgid "projects"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5485(glossterm) msgid "project"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5492(para) msgid "A logical grouping of users within Compute; defines quotas and access to VM images."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5501(secondary) msgid "project ID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5498(glossterm) msgid "project ID"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5505(para) msgid "User-defined alphanumeric string in Compute; the name of a project."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5514(secondary) msgid "project VPN"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5511(glossterm) msgid "project VPN"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5518(para) msgid "Alternative term for a cloudpipe."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5524(primary) msgid "promiscuous mode"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5523(glossterm) msgid "promiscuous mode"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5528(para) msgid "Causes the network interface to pass all traffic it receives to the host rather than passing only the frames addressed to it."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5536(primary) msgid "protected property"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5535(glossterm) msgid "protected property"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5540(para) msgid "Generally, extra properties on an Image Service image to which only cloud administrators have access. an alternative to RabbitMQ." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5713(primary) msgid "quarantine" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5712(glossterm) msgid "quarantine" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5717(para) msgid "If Object Storage finds objects, containers, or accounts that are corrupt, they are placed in this state, are not replicated, cannot be read by clients, and a correct copy is re-replicated." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5725(primary) msgid "Quick EMUlator (QEMU)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5724(glossterm) msgid "Quick EMUlator (QEMU)" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5729(para) msgid "QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5732(para) msgid "One of the hypervisors supported by OpenStack, generally used for development purposes." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5739(primary) msgid "quotas" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5738(glossterm) msgid "quota" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5743(para) msgid "In Compute and Block Storage, the ability to set resource limits on a per-project basis." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5752(title) msgid "R" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5756(primary) msgid "RabbitMQ" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5755(glossterm) msgid "RabbitMQ" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5760(para) msgid "The default message queue software used by OpenStack." msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5766(primary) msgid "Rackspace Cloud Files" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5765(glossterm) msgid "Rackspace Cloud Files" msgstr "" #: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5770(para) msgid "Released as open source by Rackspace in 2010; The virtualization platform should ensure that the reboot action has completed successfully, even in cases in which the underlying domain/VM is paused or halted/stopped."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5875(primary) msgid "rebuilding"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5874(glossterm) msgid "rebuild"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:5879(para) msgid "Removes all data on the server and replaces it with the specified image. Public IP addresses can be shared across multiple servers for use in various high-availability scenarios. When an IP address is shared to another server, the cloud network restrictions are modified to enable each server to listen to and respond on that IP address. You can optionally specify that the target server network configuration be modified. Shared IP addresses can be used with many standard heartbeat facilities, such as keepalive, that monitor for failure and manage IP failover."#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6562(primary) msgid "shared IP groups"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6561(glossterm) msgid "shared IP group"#: ./doc/glossary/glossary-terms.xml:6566(para) msgid "A collection of servers that can share IPs with other members of the group. commit_message:
Support for per disk volume measurements

This enables us to track per disk read/write
requests and bytes. The existing samples accumulated
by the incoming data are used to yield needed per
disk samples. Also includes the names for the
assocaited disks as part of the metadata. For per
device pollsters, the resource id is a combination
of instance id and device name. Unit tests included
to cover the above use cases.

Change-Id: I69ab6a99c61e051cfb367c1276b8886f25ae6be7
Implements: blueprint instance-per-disk-measurement

commit_message:
Migrate test_aggregates_basic_ops to Tempest clients

This patch uses Tempest clients instead of Official clients. This is
part of the migrating all scenario tests to using tempest own clients.

Partially-implements: bp:tempest-client-scenarios
Change-Id: I1cdf391652fbb14d5c527e8702c392904ef35a37

commit_message:
Remove "builtins = _" from tox.ini

In Horizon "_" (ugettext_lazy) is defined by usual imports,
so "builtins = _" in tox.ini is unnecessary.

Change-Id: I2d429f5a4783f8da44739da7fe3ba1d6c76f4146
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/90/114690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix listing security group rules

It was failing when there are too many security groups, since we're
hitting a RequestURITooLong exception.

Co-Authored-By: Vincent Untz <vuntz@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ilya Shakhat <ishakhat@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: If94b6a2ed6878efad1224e056ecf43e65e85e821
Closes-Bug: 1271462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/90/95990/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys import urllib from neutronclient.common import exceptions from neutronclient.common import utils def _test_extend_list(self, mox_calls): resources = "security_groups" data = [{'name': 'default', 'security_group_id': 'secgroupid%02d' % i, 'remote_group_id': 'remgroupid%02d' % i} for i in range(10)] cmd = securitygroup.ListSecurityGroupRule( test_cli20.MyApp(sys.stdout), None) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(cmd, "get_client") self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.client.httpclient, "request") cmd.get_client().MultipleTimes().AndReturn(self.client) path = getattr(self.client, resources + '_path') mox_calls(path, data) self.mox.ReplayAll() known_args, _vs = cmd.get_parser( 'list' + resources).parse_known_args() cmd.extend_list(data, known_args) self.mox.VerifyAll() self.mox.UnsetStubs() def _build_test_data(self, data, excess=0): # Length of a query filter on security group rule id # in these testcases, id='secgroupid%02d' (with len(id)=12 sec_group_id_filter_len = 12 response = [] replace_rules = {'security_group_id': 'security_group', 'remote_group_id': 'remote_group'} search_opts = {'fields': ['id', 'name']} sec_group_ids = set() for rule in data: for key in replace_rules: sec_group_ids.add(rule[key]) response.append({'id': rule[key], 'name': 'default'}) sec_group_ids = list(sec_group_ids) filterRespList = [{"filter": "", "response": None}, {"filter": "", "response": None}] sec_group_count = len(sec_group_ids) max_size = ((sec_group_id_filter_len * sec_group_count) - excess) chunk_size = max_size / sec_group_id_filter_len for i in range(0, sec_group_count, chunk_size): listIndex = i / chunk_size search_opts['id'] = sec_group_ids[i: i + chunk_size] if type(search_opts) is dict and search_opts: params = utils.safe_encode_dict(search_opts) filterRespList[listIndex]["filter"] = "" + \ urllib.urlencode(params, doseq=1) resp_str = self.client.serialize({'security_groups': response}) filterRespList[listIndex]["response"] = \ (test_cli20.MyResp(200), resp_str) return filterRespList def test_extend_list(self): def mox_calls(path, data): filterRespList = self._build_test_data(data) self.client.httpclient.request( test_cli20.MyUrlComparator(test_cli20.end_url( path, filterRespList[0]["filter"]), self.client), 'GET', body=None, headers=mox.ContainsKeyValue( 'X-Auth-Token', test_cli20.TOKEN)).AndReturn( filterRespList[0]["response"]) self._test_extend_list(mox_calls) def test_extend_list_exceed_max_uri_len(self): def mox_calls(path, data): # 1 char of extra URI len will cause a split in 2 requests self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.client, "_check_uri_length") self.client._check_uri_length(mox.IgnoreArg()).AndRaise( exceptions.RequestURITooLong(excess=1)) filterRespList = self._build_test_data(data, excess=1) for item in filterRespList: self.client._check_uri_length( mox.IgnoreArg()).AndReturn(None) self.client.httpclient.request( test_cli20.end_url(path, item["filter"]), 'GET', body=None, headers=mox.ContainsKeyValue('X-Auth-Token', test_cli20.TOKEN)).AndReturn(item["response"]) self._test_extend_list(mox_calls)

Add docs for agent driver with devstack

This allows users to run Ironic with the agent driver in devstack.

Change-Id: I9703041bde6bd1c5f19b1c732cda7e7b025aa8c1

commit_message:
Relax check for router interface in _verify_network_details

This is to catch ports that are interfaces for both centralized
and distributed routers.

Closes-bug: #1355537

Change-Id: I1da8536a4b457f8ae20c03ecd7ef9d39075b0cf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/20/113420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self._is_router_port(i)] def _is_router_port(self, port): """Return True if port is a router interface.""" # NOTE(armando-migliaccio): match device owner for both centralized # and distributed routers; 'device_owner' is "" by default. return port['device_owner'].startswith('network:router_interface')

subject: Make non-admin users can unshelve a server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-03 23:49:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/83d739892e7826c4b377786cfa7432c9fecffe98', 'message': 'Make non-admin users can unshelve a server

If non-admin users try to unshelve a server, nova-compute fails due to
"User does not have admin privileges" while getting hypervisor_hostname.
This patch changes the user context to admin's one temporarily to get the
hypervisor_hostname.

Closes-Bug: 1245312
Change-Id: I84dce1f7694d09c1281da13c6008bb3aa5940f85
(cherry picked from commit 13fa2caaad796ee66c432e0d19fd6f759234a964)
'}]
commit_message:
Make non-admin users can unshelve a server

If non-admin users try to unshelve a server, nova-compute fails due to
"User does not have admin privileges" while getting hypervisor_hostname.
This patch changes the user context to admin's one temporarily to get the
hypervisor_hostname.

Closes-Bug: 1245312
Change-Id: I84dce1f7694d09c1281da13c6008bb3aa5940f85
(cherry picked from commit 13fa2caaad796ee66c432e0d19fd6f759234a964)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/77734/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: compute_info = self._get_compute_info(context.elevated(), self.host)

commit_message:
Add auth and remote connections support to MongoDB

Add options to provide admin user login and
password to be used while managing databases
and users.

Admin user should have at least permissions
'root' and 'restore'.

If there is no admin user mongo will work
in 'localhost exception' mode allowing
administration from the local interface.

Closes-Bug: 1354494

Change-Id: I253ee50523fba66586e7a42a7f0772adebe96e83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/97/114297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $admin_username = undef, $admin_password = undef, $admin_host = undef, $admin_database = undef, admin_username => $admin_username, admin_password => $admin_password, admin_host => $admin_host, admin_database => $admin_database, require => Class['mongodb::server'], fail("Parameter 'password_hash' or 'password' should be provided to mongodb::db.") admin_username => $admin_username, admin_password => $admin_password, admin_host => $admin_host, admin_database => $admin_database,
deleted_lines: require => Class['mongodb::server'], fail("Parameter 'password_hash' or 'password' should be provided.")

commit_message:
Explicitly setting of PKI token signing cert

Enable setting of the cert, key, and cacert for PKI token signing.

Replaces abandoned change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/93598

Change-Id: I91f1c3c6f2d1fcb477699b2b23b56cbe22006d4e
Closes-Bug: #1319470
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/60/101260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [enable_pki_setup] Enable call to pki_setup to generate the cert for signing pki tokens, # if it doesn't already exist. If you are providing your own signing cert, make this false. # [signing_certfile] Location of the cert file for signing pki tokens. Optional. If you are # providing your own signing cert, make enable_pki_setup false and ensure the signing cert # is installed at the signing_certificate path. # Default: /etc/keystone/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem # [signing_keyfile] Location of the key file for signing pki tokens. Optional. If you are # providing your own signing cert, make enable_pki_setup false and ensure the signing cert # key file is installed at the signing_keyfile path. # Default: /etc/keystone/ssl/private/signing_key.pem # [signing_ca_certs] Use this CA certs file along with signing_certfile/signing_keyfile for # signing pki tokens. Optional. Default: /etc/keystone/ssl/certs/ca.pem # [signing_ca_key] Use this CA key file along with signing_certfile/signing_keyfile for signing # pki tokens. Optional. Default: /etc/keystone/ssl/private/cakey.pem $signing_certfile = '/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/signing_cert.pem', $signing_keyfile = '/etc/keystone/ssl/private/signing_key.pem', $signing_ca_certs = '/etc/keystone/ssl/certs/ca.pem', $signing_ca_key = '/etc/keystone/ssl/private/cakey.pem', keystone_config { 'token/provider': value => 'keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider'; 'signing/certfile': value => $signing_certfile; 'signing/keyfile': value => $signing_keyfile; 'signing/ca_certs': value => $signing_ca_certs; 'signing/ca_key': value => $signing_ca_key; } # Only do pki_setup if we were asked to do so creates => $signing_keyfile,
deleted_lines: # [enable_pki_setup] Enable call to pki_setup. keystone_config { 'token/provider': value => 'keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider' } creates => '/etc/keystone/ssl/private/signing_key.pem',

commit_message:
Remove objectify decorator from dbapi's {get, register}_conductor()

This patch removes the objectify decorator from the get_conductor and
register_conductor dbapi's methods.

For get_condutor() method there's an objects interface to it so this patch
make the code/tests use the object interface vs direct calls to dbapi.

The problem with the objectify decorator is that dbapi methods
doesn't get the context, so when forming the RPC object using the
decorator we can't store the context within the object (which is what
we want to do to have consistent object interfaces).

Partial-Bug: 1314732
Change-Id: I1a955a59435b35277f3bbff2c02c07dd1a4c1d66

commit_message:
Tunnel ID range validation for VXLAN/GRE networks

Currently,there is no check which validates the values of
tunnel ID range for VXLAN/GRE networks.It should be between
1 to 16777215.

Closes-Bug: #1342143
Closes-Bug: #1306488

Change-Id: I7b236bdc48112354b4677bc885a02113d6cbacb6

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in console

This patch makes sure that the error gets raised if it fails to
remove the console subprocess when stopping the console for a node.
It also makes sure that the same error gets raised for the start
console function which calls the stop console function to clean up
the old console subprocess.

Change-Id: I7be9a6c361121aab48bcff2c08c0d2892ae7491e

commit_message:
Implicitly ignore attributes that are mapped to None in LDAP

Attributes that are mapped to None in LDAP trigger a 500 error when
performing a search if they are not explicitly ignored in keystone's
configuration.  These attributes should always be ignored, even if
the admin left the attribute out of the ignore list.

Change-Id: Ibbabdd0013059d5720250816764021a0b3ce8ce0
Closes-bug: #1335437
(cherry picked from commit 10a3edb7800d380ed72fcbbaae98251998c0e2c7)

added_lines: def test_unignored_user_none_mapping(self): # Ensure that an attribute that maps to None that is not explicitly # ignored in configuration is implicitly ignored without triggering # an error. conf = self.get_config(CONF.identity.default_domain_id) conf.ldap.user_attribute_ignore = ['enabled', 'email', 'tenants', 'tenantId'] self.reload_backends(CONF.identity.default_domain_id) user = {'name': u'fk1', 'password': u'fkpass1', 'domain_id': CONF.identity.default_domain_id, } user_ref = self.identity_api.create_user(user) # If this doesn't raise, then the test is successful. self.identity_api.get_user(user_ref['id'])

commit_message:
Fix duplicate help strings

Currently:
$ sahara help bash-completion
usage: sahara bash-completion

Prints all of the commands to stdout to support bash completion. Prints
all of the commands and options to stdout so that the sahara.bash_completion
script doesn't have to hard code them.

$ sahara help job-binary-data-create
usage: sahara job-binary-data-create [--file FILE]

Store data in the internal DB. Store data in the internal DB. Use 'swift
upload' instead of this command. Use this command only if Swift is not
available.

Update the strings to avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I4bb692026e1bfc2c210a976f3dfedb550d544f26

commit_message:
Removes get_port_by_vif

VIF is not indexed by the databse, it lives inside the extra attribute
which is a data blob, so the method is not used.

Change-Id: I11ce35bae1aa81c38c8ebc87251148ae65f3a30e
Partial-bug: 1314732

commit_message:
Add tunnel_types in ovs_neutron_plugin.ini.erb

Nowadays, there is no tunnel_types item in ovs_
neutron_plugin.ini.erb template. And user can not
assign value to this item by environment. Therefore,
the vxlan enablement will failure because of the item
default value is '[]' which will disable tunneling
support in the agent.

Fixes bug #1355663

Change-Id: I21378cbc3fe021b6763dd9f560e027ddd704c982
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-network refs/changes/08/114108/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The types of tenant network tunnels supported by the agent. # Setting this will enable tunneling support in the agent. This can be set to # either 'gre' or 'vxlan'. If this is unset, it will default to [] and # disable tunneling in the agent. When running the agent with the OVS # plugin, this value must be the same as "tunnel_type" in the "[ovs]" section. # When running the agent with ML2, you can specify as many values here as # your compute hosts supports. default['openstack']['network']['openvswitch']['tunnel_types'] = nil

commit_message:
Add plugin config file to /etc/default/neutron-server

Debian platforms uses /etc/default/neutron-server to tell
neutron-server service which plugin configuration file to load.

Configure it.

commit_message:
Introduce support for BLOCKSTORAGESCALE

This change introduces support for BLOCKSTORAGESCALE which initially
allows for the deployment of additional cinder-volume nodes, all
using the LVM driver, in addition to the controller nodes.

Summary of changes:
  - documentation is updated to mention existence of BLOCKSTORAGESCALE
  - additional overcloud-cinder-volume image is (conditionally) built

Change-Id: Id7bc4c2e66b97f109f1ea91e5e3e45d02eddb3cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/36/111136/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS=${OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS:-''} OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS="$OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS mariadb-dev-rpm"## ``$OVERCLOUD_*_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS`` (CONTROL, COMPUTE, BLOCKSTORAGE) are OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS="$OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS snmpd"## #. Create your block storage image if some block storage nodes are to be used. This ## is the image the undercloud deploys for the additional cinder-volume instances. ## :: if [ $OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGESCALE -gt 0 ]; then if [ ! -e $TRIPLEO_ROOT/overcloud-cinder-volume.qcow2 -o "$USE_CACHE" == "0" ]; then #nodocs $TRIPLEO_ROOT/diskimage-builder/bin/disk-image-create $NODE_DIST \ -a $NODE_ARCH -o $TRIPLEO_ROOT/overcloud-cinder-volume ntp hosts \ baremetal cinder-volume cinder-tgt os-collect-config \ dhcp-all-interfaces $DIB_COMMON_ELEMENTS \ $OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS 2>&1 | \ tee $TRIPLEO_ROOT/dib-overcloud-cinder-volume.log fi #nodocs ## #. And again load the image into Glance, unless you are just building the images. ## :: if [ -z "$BUILD_ONLY" ]; then #nodocs OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_ID=$(load-image -d $TRIPLEO_ROOT/overcloud-cinder-volume.qcow2) fi #nodocs fi expected_nodes=$(( $OVERCLOUD_COMPUTESCALE + $OVERCLOUD_CONTROLSCALE + $OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGESCALE ))if [ $OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGESCALE -gt 0 ]; then ENV_JSON=$(jq '.parameters = {} + .parameters + { "BlockStorageImage": "'"${OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGE_ID}"'", }' <<< $ENV_JSON) fi BLOCKSTORAGESCALE=$OVERCLOUD_BLOCKSTORAGESCALE \

commit_message:
Replace nullable from primary keys in tz_network_bindings with default

Columns vlan_id and phy_uuid were both nullable and primary keys.
Primary keys cannot be nulls. This situation caused problems in
autogenerating scripts creating always migration that set these columns
to nullable.

Instead of having primary keys nullable this patch creates a default
values.

Change-Id: I04642f6d6ad232997a593bff8ca44f9a7a803ffd
Closes-bug: #1346900
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/90/108690/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: phy_uuid = Column(String(36), primary_key=True) vlan_id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, autoincrement=False)
deleted_lines: phy_uuid = Column(String(36), primary_key=True, nullable=True) vlan_id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, nullable=True, autoincrement=False)

commit_message:
Fix crash when downloading a pseudo-directory

If a user creates an object with name ending with a slash, then
downloading such container ends in a traceback like this:

..............
test5g.file [auth 1.516s, headers 1.560s, total 244.565s, 22.089 MB/s]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/swiftclient/multithreading.py", lin
    result = self.func(item, *self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/swiftclient/shell.py", line 403, in
    fp = open(path, 'wb')
IOError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: 'first-pseudo-folder/'

The proposed fix is not to save this object. Note that the contents of
the object are available with --output option, as before. Only the
crash is fixed.

Even though we do not use the contents, we download the object and
check its Etag, in case. We also create a corresponding directory,
in case the pseudo-directory contains no objects.

The format of printout is changed, so user realizes easier when
pseudo-directory convention is in effect. Note that this is not a
compatibility issue because previously there was crash in such case.

Change-Id: I3352f7a4eaf9970961af0cc84c4706fc1eab281d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/39/112139/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [None, [{'name': 'pseudo/'}]], calls = [mock.call('container', 'object', headers={}, resp_chunk_size=65536), mock.call('container', 'pseudo/', headers={}, resp_chunk_size=65536)] connection.return_value.get_object.assert_has_calls( calls, any_order=True) calls = [mock.call('object', 'wb'), mock.call('/dev/null', 'wb')] mock_open.assert_has_calls(calls, any_order=True) self.assertEqual(mock_open.call_count, 2)

This fixes the test_tag_lifecycle test, which broke with a randomized

Partial-bug: #1348818

commit_message:
Do not assume order of images

This fixes the test_tag_lifecycle test, which broke with a randomized
PYTHONHASHSEED.

Previously, the test assumed that the values in the list of tag names
would remain constant. The test now sorts the results and compares to a
sorted set.

Change-Id: If5a2ef683fcf55520c7d539f1b90aefaba4739d5
Partial-bug: #1348818

commit_message:
Fix statuses for environment state

With new horizon status display were broken:
progress bar were right after environment get
into the "Configuring" state

This fix gets back normal behavior: progress bar will appear
only when environment is deploying

Change-Id: I2c27f1d70b98088962e276cae26c2e85d8026317
Closes-Bug: #1335309

deleted_lines: (None, True), ('Ready to configure', True), ('Ready', True), ('Configuring', False),

commit_message:
ML2 Type driver refactor

This commit refactors the ML2 type driver architecture to allow
dynamic segments.

Change-Id: I5d2075c4d053b689d6d7603b4b191c68d0974cbe
Implements: Blueprint ml2-type-driver-refactor
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/110404/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.type_driver_common import TypeDriverMixin network_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('networks.id', ondelete="CASCADE"), nullable=True) provider_network = sa.Column(sa.Boolean, default=False)class GreTypeDriver(helpers.TypeDriverHelper, type_tunnel.TunnelTypeDriver, TypeDriverMixin): def reserve_provider_segment(self, session, network_id, segment): alloc.allocated = True alloc.network_id = network_id alloc.provider_network = True def allocate_tenant_segment(self, session, network_id): alloc.network_id = network_id def allocate_static_segment(self, session, net_data): segments = self._process_provider_create(net_data) net_id = net_data.get('id') if segments: all_segments = [] for segment in segments: one_seg = self.reserve_provider_segment(session, net_id, segment) all_segments.append(one_seg) return all_segments else: return [self.allocate_tenant_segment(session, net_id)] def get_segment(self, context, network_id): LOG.debug(_("Returning segments for network %s") % network_id) alloc = (context.session.query(GreAllocation). filter_by(network_id=network_id).one()) return {api.NETWORK_TYPE: p_const.TYPE_GRE, api.PHYSICAL_NETWORK: None, api.SEGMENTATION_ID: alloc.gre_id} def release_static_segment(self, session, network_id): with session.begin(subtransactions=True): try: alloc = (session.query(GreAllocation). filter_by(network_id=network_id). with_lockmode('update'). one()) alloc.allocated = False gre_id = alloc['gre_id'] for lo, hi in self.gre_id_ranges: if lo <= gre_id <= hi: LOG.debug(_("Releasing gre tunnel %s to pool"), gre_id) break else: session.delete(alloc) LOG.debug(_("Releasing gre tunnel %s outside pool"), gre_id) except sa_exc.NoResultFound: LOG.warning(_("gre_id %s not found"), gre_id)
deleted_lines: class GreTypeDriver(helpers.TypeDriverHelper, type_tunnel.TunnelTypeDriver): def reserve_provider_segment(self, session, segment): def allocate_tenant_segment(self, session): def release_segment(self, session, segment): gre_id = segment[api.SEGMENTATION_ID] inside = any(lo <= gre_id <= hi for lo, hi in self.gre_id_ranges) with session.begin(subtransactions=True): query = session.query(GreAllocation).filter_by(gre_id=gre_id) if inside: count = query.update({"allocated": False}) if count: LOG.debug("Releasing gre tunnel %s to pool", gre_id) else: count = query.delete() if count: LOG.debug("Releasing gre tunnel %s outside pool", gre_id) if not count: LOG.warning(_("gre_id %s not found"), gre_id) def get_gre_allocation(self, session, gre_id): return session.query(GreAllocation).filter_by(gre_id=gre_id).first()

commit_message:
Rename 'sid' to 'user' in access rules and sec services

Rename 'sid' (secure identifier) to 'user' for better understanding by user.
Changed parts:
- share access rule type
- security services

Change-Id: I75eceab6ef6d91cebb9143abeaa8a5400c72848b

commit_message:
Remove d_info param from _destroy_images

A d_info dict was being passed to _destroy_images but wasn't used. Remove it and update calls to it. 

Change-Id: I6e50e58237d1b29b5234730099344ac432671b09

'}]
commit_message:
Allow optional xml middleware configuration

This is to make lxml optional so that we do not depend on lxml if we are
not using it.

bp optional-xml

Change-Id: I254329f33105228c421796129bb4fd6b673dad2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/48/111048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============ Optional Xml ============ `bp optional-xml <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/optional-xml>`_ Currently Keystone allows defining filters in the keystone-paste.ini file. When the `XmlBodyMiddleware` is omitted, keystone still tries to include the lxml library. The purpose of this spec is to maintain the functionality of the middle-ware so that it can be optional. Problem Description =================== As an OpenStack deployer I want to be able to install keystone without having to install lxml and avoid compile-time errors. The current implementation does not allow this because excluding the filter still requires lxml to be installed. Proposed Change =============== If XmlBodyMiddleware is not enabled, keystone should not depend on lxml Alternatives ------------ None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: nonameentername (Werner Mendizabal <werner.mendizabal@rackspace.com> <werner.mendizabal@gmail.com>) Other contributors: ldbragst (Lance Bragstad <lance.bragstad@rackspace.com> <lbragstad@gmail.com>) Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ None Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
labs: rename openstackrc file

Rename labs-openstackrc.sh to admin-openstackrc.sh because we are about
to introduce a second openstackrc.sh for a user that is obviously also
part of labs, but not an admin.

Change-Id: Ifa58b260e7b5386ce7ccc6075cdf5ef2dc1ee9ce

commit_message:
labs: admin uses port 35357 for authentication

With this patch, the admin user connects to port 35357 (adminurl)
instead of 5000 (internalurl) for authentication.

Change-Id: I94c73d75a3e4951d96994852bead1ff583009a08

commit_message:
This is to fix glance failing an install

According to
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3513773/change-mysql-default-character-set-to-utf-8-in-my-cnf
this is how to fix this.
This is the error that is causing this headache:
CRITICAL glance [-] ValueError: Tables "migrate_version" have non utf8
collation, please make sure all tables are CHARSET=utf8

Change-Id: I869c59ccf2bb4fb190c86773374539ac757de4bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-ops-database refs/changes/88/113588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: character-set-server = utf8
